title: Online Assistive Technology Development for Nursing Care of People with Disabilities: Reflective Research-Based Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of nursing and assistive technology development, and experience with online educational tools
context.additional_context: Strengthening accessibility technology development capabilities integrating mathematics and nursing for office/administrative professionals with higher education backgrounds

learning_goals: A prototype of a customized online assistive technology for individuals with disabilities is designed by applying the five stages of the Falkembach instructional design model.
Effectiveness and accessibility issues in existing assistive technology cases are analyzed in three or more ways using reflective research methods.
Usability data of assistive technologies is interpreted, and improvement strategies are proposed using statistical approaches (ANOVA, regression analysis).

resources: Zoom Screen Sharing and Whiteboard Features

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
